October 12, 1975: Fiction
RAGTIME, by E. L. Doctorow. (Random House, $8.95.) A syncopated-gaited
evocation of turn-of-the-century America.
LOOKING FOR MR. GOODBAR, by Judith Rossner. (Simon &Schuster, $7.95.)
Stunning psychological study of a woman's passive complicity in her own death.
SHOGUN, by James Clavell. (Atheneum, $12.50.) Sprawling tale of intrigue and
bloodshed in 17th-century Japan.
THE GREAT TRAIN ROBBERY, by Michael Crichton, (Knopf, $7.95.) Ingenious
caper carried out in an authentic Victorian milieu.
THE MONEYCHANGERS, by Arthur Hailey. (Doubleday, $10.) The "Airport" et
seq. treatment -- this time applied to banking.
CIRCUS, by Alistair MacLean. (Doubleday, $6.95.) Another thriller in the MacLean
mode!
HUMBOLDT'S GIFT, by Saul Bellow. (Viking Press, $10.) Bellow on money, art,
power, and ideas in America.
CURTAIN, by Agatha Christie. (Dodd, Mead, $7.95.) Can this be the end of
Hercule Poirot?
THE EAGLE HAS LANDED, by Jack Higgins. (Holt, Rinehart & Winston, $8.95.)
Mixed fact and fiction about 1943 plot to kidnap Churchill.
CENTENNIAL, by James Michener.  (Random House, $12.50.) Dioramic historical
novel covering the land and people around Centennial, Colo.
October 12, 1975
Non-Fiction
SYLVIA PORTER'S MONEY BOOK, by Sylvia Porter, $12.50.) Useful home
financial adviser.
BREACH OF FAITH, by Theodore H. White. (Atheneum $10.95.) The unraveling
of the President, post-1972.
TOTAL FITNESS, by Laurence E. Morehouse and Leonard Gross. (Simon &
Schuster, $6.95.) Twelve hours to a better body is the claim.
TM: Discovering Inner Energy and Overcoming Stress, by Harold H. Bloomfield,
Michael Peter Cain and Dennis T. Jaffe. (Delacorte, $8.95.) The theory and
practice of Transcendental Meditation.
WINNING THROUGH INTIMIDATION, by Robert J. Ringer. (Funk & Wagnalls,
$9.95.) How to close the big deal.
MONEY, by John Kenneth Galbraith. (Houghton, Mifflin, $10.) Galbraith
demystifies money but not with complete objectivity.
THE SAVE YOUR LIFE DIET, by David Reuben, M.D. (Random House $7.95.)
Eat more long-fiber foods.
WITHOUT FEATHERS, by Woody Allen. (Random House, $7.95.) Humorous
pieces showing Allen in fine form.
THE ASCENT OF MAN,  by J. Bronowski. (Little, Brown, $15.) Instructive lecture
course on the evolution of science and technology.
THE GREAT RAILWAY BAZAAR, by Paul Theroux. (Houghton, Mifflin, $10.)
Fascinating observations along Asian railways and byways.
